CreateDisasterRecoverGroup.document: This example shows you how to create a spread placement group.

https://cvm.tencentcloudapi.com/?Action=CreateDisasterRecoverGroup
&Name=Physical machine spread placement group
&Type=HOST
&<Common request parameters>
CreateDisasterRecoverGroup.title: Creating a spread placement group

CreateImage.document: This example shows you how to create an image from the instance “ins-6pb6lrmy”. If the instance is running, perform a soft shutdown. If the soft shutdown fails, the task will end (default semantics).
CreateImage.title: Creating an image

DeleteDisasterRecoverGroups.document: This example shows you how to delete a spread placement group.
DeleteDisasterRecoverGroups.title: Deleting a spread placement group

DeleteImages.document: This example shows you how to delete the image `img-34vaef8fe`. If the image is in use or the image ID does not exist, no operation will be performed and an error code will be returned.
DeleteImages.title: Deleting an image

DescribeDisasterRecoverGroupQuota.document: This example shows you how to query the quota of your placement groups.
DescribeDisasterRecoverGroupQuota.title: Querying placement group quota

DescribeDisasterRecoverGroups.document: This example shows you how to query the information of a spread placement group.
DescribeDisasterRecoverGroups.title: Querying the information of a spread placement group

DescribeHosts.document: This example shows you how to query the details of one or more CDH instances.

DescribeImageQuota.document: This example shows you how to query your image quota.

DescribeImageSharePermission.document: This example shows you how to query the sharing information of the `img-6pb6lrmy` image.

DescribeImages.document: This example shows you how to query the information of an image by the image ID.
DescribeImages.title: Querying an image by the image ID

DescribeImages.document: This example shows you how to query all private images under an account.
DescribeImages.title: Querying images by image type

DescribeImportImageOs.title: Querying the supported operating systems of imported images

DescribeInstanceFamilyConfigs.document: This example shows you how to query the supported instance families in the Guangzhou region.

DescribeInstanceTypeConfigs.document: This example shows you how to query instance types of the family `I1` in Guangzhou Zone 2.

DescribeInstanceVncUrl.document: This example shows you how to query the VNC URL of an instance.
DescribeInstanceVncUrl.title: Querying the VNC URL of an instance

DescribeInstances.document: This example shows you how to query instances in Guangzhou Zone 1 and Guangzhou Zone 2, and limit the number of returned result to one.
DescribeInstances.title: Viewing the list of instances

DescribeInstances.document: This example shows you how to query an instance by using this API after you stop the instance via the `StopInstances` API. You will see that the value of `LatestOperation` is `StopInstances` and `LatestOperationState` is `OPERATING`.
DescribeInstances.title: Querying the status of the instance’s latest operation

DescribeInstances.document: This example shows you how to query instances associated with the tag `city: shenzhen`.
DescribeInstances.title: Querying instances associated with a tag

DescribeInstancesOperationLimit.title: Querying the number of configuration downgrade operations allowed

DescribeInstancesStatus.document: This example shows you how to query two instances in the list of instance status.
DescribeInstancesStatus.title: Querying the list of instance status

DescribeInternetChargeTypeConfigs.document: This example shows you how to query the list of all network billing modes and select one for the CVM created using the API.
DescribeInternetChargeTypeConfigs.title: Querying network billing modes

DescribeRegions.title: Sample Request

DescribeReservedInstancesConfigInfos.title: Querying reserved instance configurations

DescribeZoneInstanceConfigInfos.document: This example shows you how to query the list of instance configurations using availability zone and billing method as filters.
DescribeZoneInstanceConfigInfos.title: Querying the configurations of models in an availability zone

DescribeZones.document: This example shows you how to query information of availability zones in the Guangzhou region. To return its Chinese name of the availability zone, you need to pass the parameter `Language=zh-CN`.
DescribeZones.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: cvm.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: DescribeZones
X-TC-Language: zh-CN
&<Common request parameters>

{}
DescribeZones.title: Querying the Chinese name of an availability zone

DescribeZones.document: This example shows you how to query the availability zones in the Guangzhou region. Its English name will be returned by default if the parameter `Language` is not passed in.
DescribeZones.title: Querying the English name of an availability zone

DisassociateInstancesKeyPairs.title: Disassociating a key pair from an instance

ImportImage.document: This example shows you how to import an image.
ImportImage.title: Importing an image

InquirePricePurchaseReservedInstancesOff.title: Querying the price of reserved instance offerings

InquiryPriceResetInstance.title: Querying the price of a pay-as-you-go instance with a new configuration

InquiryPriceResetInstancesInternetMaxBan.document: This example shows you how to query the price for changing the bandwidth of the instance “ins-fd8spnmq” to 20 Mbps.
InquiryPriceResetInstancesInternetMaxBan.title: Querying the price of a pay-as-you-go instance with a new bandwidth cap

InquiryPriceResetInstancesType.title: Querying the price of a monthly-subscribed instance with new configurations

InquiryPriceResizeInstanceDisks.title: Querying the price for expanding the disk capacity of a pay-as-you-go instance

InquiryPriceRunInstances.document: This example shows you how to query the price of creating an instance in Shanghai Zone 2 with the image `img-pmqg1cw7`. Only the required `Placement.Zone` and `ImageId` parameters are passed in. The other parameters use system default values.
InquiryPriceRunInstances.title: Querying the price of an instance with only the required parameters

InquiryPriceRunInstances.document: This example shows you how to query the price for purchasing one 64C256G standard (S5.16XLARGE256) instance in Shanghai Zone 2 using the image `img-pmqg1cw7`. The other configurations are as follows: billing method: monthly subscription for one month with auto-renewal upon expiration; system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; data disk: 100 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network type: VPC; public network billing: pay-as-you-go by traffic on an hourly basis; public network bandwidth cap: 10 Mbps; public IP: randomly assigned; instance name: QCLOUD-TEST; login password: Qcloud@TestApi123++; Cloud Monitoring service: enabled; Anti-DDoS: enabled.
InquiryPriceRunInstances.title: Querying the price of a monthly subscription instance

InquiryPriceRunInstances.document: This example shows you how to query the price for purchasing one 64C256G standard (S5.16XLARGE256) instance in Shanghai Zone 2 using the image `img-pmqg1cw7`. The other configurations are as follows: billing mode: pay-as-you-go on an hourly basis; system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; data disk: 100 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network type: VPC; public network billing: pay-as-you-go by traffic on an hourly basis; public network bandwidth cap: 10 Mbps; public IP: randomly assigned; instance name: QCLOUD-TEST; login password: Qcloud@TestApi123++; Cloud Monitoring service: enabled; Anti-DDoS: enabled.
InquiryPriceRunInstances.title: Querying the price of purchasing an hourly-billed pay-as-you-go instance

ModifyDisasterRecoverGroupAttribute.document: This example shows you how to modify the attributes of a spread placement group.
ModifyDisasterRecoverGroupAttribute.input:
https://cvm.tencentcloudapi.com/?Action=ModifyDisasterRecoverGroupAttribute
&DisasterRecoverGroupId=ps-58l1hu01
&Name=Physical machine disaster recovery group 1
&<Common request parameters>
ModifyDisasterRecoverGroupAttribute.title: Modifying attributes of a spread placement group

ModifyHostsAttribute.title: Modifying the attributes of a CDH instance

ModifyImageAttribute.title: Modifying image name

ModifyInstancesAttribute.document: This example shows you how to modify the names of two instances.
ModifyInstancesAttribute.title: Modifying instance names

ModifyInstancesProject.document: This example shows you how to change the projects of two instances to a specified one.
ModifyInstancesProject.title: Modifying the projects of two instances

ModifyInstancesVpcAttribute.document: This example shows you how to migrate the `r8hr2upy` and `5d8a23rs` instances to the `dcs9x3gz` subnet of the `1urkhbj4` VPC and specify 10.0.0.18 as the private IP of the `r8hr2upy` instance and 10.0.0.19 as that of the `5d8a23rs` instance.
ModifyInstancesVpcAttribute.title: Migrating an instance to a VPC and specifying the instance IP

ModifyKeyPairAttribute.title: Modifying key pair name

ModifyKeyPairAttribute.document: This example shows you how to modify the key pair description.

RebootInstances.document: This example shows you how to restart two instances.
RebootInstances.title: Restarting instances

ResetInstance.document: This example shows you how to reinstall an instance using the specified image, login password, and enhanced services, and expand the system disk of the instance.
ResetInstance.title: Reinstalling an instance

ResetInstancesInternetMaxBandwidth.document: This example shows you how to modify the public network bandwidth cap of an instance.
ResetInstancesInternetMaxBandwidth.title: Modifying the public network bandwidth cap of an instance

ResetInstancesPassword.document: This example shows you how to reset the password of a Linux/Windows instance, and then use the new password to log in to the instance.
ResetInstancesPassword.title: Resetting the password of a Linux/Windows instance

ResetInstancesType.document: This example shows you how to adjust the configuration of an instance that fails to meet your business needs.
ResetInstancesType.title: Resetting the instance model

ResizeInstanceDisks.title: Resetting the disk size of a specific instance

RunInstances.document: This example shows you how to create an instance using only the required `Placement.Zone` and `ImageId` parameters. The other parameters use system default values. The instance is created in Shanghai Zone 2 with the image `img-pmqg1cw7`.
RunInstances.title: Purchasing an instance with only the required parameters

RunInstances.document: This example shows you how to purchase one 64C256G standard (S5.16XLARGE256) instance in Shanghai Zone 2 using the image `img-pmqg1cw7`. The other configurations are as follows: billing method: monthly subscription for one month, with the auto-renewal enabled; system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; data disk: 100 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network type: VPC; public network billing: pay-as-you-go by traffic on an hourly basis; public network bandwidth cap: 10 Mbps; public IP: randomly assigned; instance name: QCLOUD-TEST; login password: Qcloud@TestApi123++; Cloud Monitor service: enabled; Anti-DDoS: enabled.
RunInstances.title: Purchasing a monthly subscription instance

RunInstances.document: This example shows you how to purchase one 64C256G standard (S5.16XLARGE256) instance in Shanghai Zone 2 using the image `img-pmqg1cw7`. The other configurations are as follows: billing mode: pay-as-you-go on an hourly basis; system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; data disk: 100 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network type: VPC; public network billing: pay-as-you-go by traffic on an hourly basis; public network bandwidth cap: 10 Mbps; public IP: randomly assigned; instance name: QCLOUD-TEST; login password: Qcloud@TestApi123++; Cloud Monitor service: enabled; Anti-DDoS: enabled.
RunInstances.title: Purchasing a pay-as-you-go instance billed on an hourly basis

RunInstances.document: This example shows you how to purchase one instance with the following configurations. Availability zone: Shanghai Zone 2; CDH: host-q88gab4i; image ID: img-pmqg1cw7; billing method: billed together with the CDH; model: 1C1G; system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; data disk: 100 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network type: VPC; public network billing: pay-as-you-go by traffic on an hourly basis; public network bandwidth cap: 10 Mbps; public IP: randomly assigned; instance name: QCLOUD-TEST; login password: Qcloud@TestApi123++; Cloud Monitor service: enabled; Anti-DDoS: enabled.
RunInstances.title: Purchasing a CDH instance

RunInstances.document: This example shows you how to purchase two instances with the following configurations. Availability zone: Shanghai Zone 2; billing method: pay-as-you-go on an hourly basis; image ID: img-dkwyg6sr; model: 64C256G standard (S5.16XLARGE256); system disk: 50 GB Premium Cloud Storage; network: VPC; VPC ID: 1urkhbj4; subnet ID: dcs9x3gz; VPC IP address: 10.0.0.18 and 10.0.0.19.
RunInstances.title: Creating an instance with the VPC IP address specified

StartInstances.document: This example shows you how to start up two shutdown instances at once.
StartInstances.title: Starting up instances with the specified IDs

StopInstances.document: This example shows you how to shut down two instances.
StopInstances.title: Shutting down instances

SyncImages.document: This example shows you how to sync an image `img-o3ycss2p` to the Guangzhou region.
SyncImages.title: Syncing an image

TerminateInstances.title: Terminating instances with the specific IDs
